description: A nylon pouch for storing 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.

variants.description: An open-top nylon pouch for storing 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_multicam>

An open-top nylon pouch for storing 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_black>

An open-top nylon pouch for storing 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_coyote>

An open-top nylon pouch for storing 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_ranger>

//weight: using weight of a similar product made roughly to the same blueprint

notes: negative trim added to account for slightly-larger items, like smoke grenades, which also fit in the same space

pocket_data.//max_item_length: added 10% to maximum length of a 40×53mm grenade to allow slightly-larger items, like smoke grenades, to also be stored here

description: A small nylon pouch for storing a single hand grenade.  This model is quick to operate because it uses a hook-and-loop flap instead of a plastic buckle.

variants.description: A small nylon pouch, intended for storing a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Can also fit a single grenade of slightly-larger volume.  Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_multicam>

A small nylon pouch, intended for storing a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Can also fit a single grenade of slightly-larger volume.  Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_multicam_black>

A small nylon pouch, intended for storing a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Can also fit a single grenade of slightly-larger volume.  Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_black>

Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_coyote>

Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_ranger>

A small nylon pouch, intended for storing a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Can also fit a single grenade of slightly-larger volume.  Unlike most models on the market, this one is relatively quick to operate, because it uses a hook-and-loop strap, rather than a plastic buckle.  There's a thin thread outline of an M67 grenade on the flap, and a print that says "FRAG OUT!" on the opposite side of it.  <variant_grey>

//weight: using weight of a similar product made roughly to the same blueprint
subtracting 5 g for the plastic buckle

notes: trim assumes the pouch is measured at farthest edges when filled
i.e., the inner pouch already has apple shape

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of M67 fragmentation grenade (400 g) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: volume of M67 fragmentation grenade (213 ml) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_item_length: longest side of M67 fragmentation grenade

//flags: replaced BELTED and OVERSIZE with CANT_WEAR

//notes: there appears to be no 4-grenade pouches on the market or in US military equipment sets, so we're modelling it as a commercial-market double-grenade pouch
description: A pair of nylon grenade pouches sewn together.  Slightly slower to operate than the alternatives.

variants.description: A pair of small nylon bags sewn together, each holding a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Because each pouch uses a plastic buckle for holding itself closed, they're relatively slow to operate.  The pair is slightly more compact than using two separate pouches.  <variant_multicam>

A pair of small nylon bags sewn together, each holding a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Because each pouch uses a plastic buckle for holding itself closed, they're relatively slow to operate.  The pair is slightly more compact than using two separate pouches.  <variant_black>

A pair of small nylon bags sewn together, each holding a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Because each pouch uses a plastic buckle for holding itself closed, they're relatively slow to operate.  The pair is slightly more compact than using two separate pouches.  <variant_coyote>

A pair of small nylon bags sewn together, each holding a single standard-issue hand grenade.  Because each pouch uses a plastic buckle for holding itself closed, they're relatively slow to operate.  The pair is slightly more compact than using two separate pouches.  <variant_olive>

//longest_side: no longest side, since the pouch appears to be easily-foldable

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of M67 fragmentation grenade (400 g) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: volume of M67 fragmentation grenade (213 ml) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_item_length: longest side of M67 fragmentation grenade

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of M67 fragmentation grenade (400 g) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: volume of M67 fragmentation grenade (213 ml) + 10% extra
pocket_data.//max_item_length: longest side of M67 fragmentation grenade

//notes: while the pouch is open-top and is advertised as accepting 40-oz water bottles, we model it as though it only takes smaller bottles, as a way to differentiate it from larger counterparts
description: A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.

variants.description: A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  The top can be constrained by a drawstring.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.  <variant_black>
A nylon pouch for storing water bottles.  The top can be constrained by a drawstring.  Takes in bottles up to 0.75L in capacity.  <variant_coyote>

//weight: the source for weight gives conflicting information about the item's weight, listing both 84 g and 0.19 lbs ≈ 86 g
we err on the side of the heavier weight simply because it has a corresponding stated weight in US customary units
//material: has a tiny plastic cord lock at the top that's not worth considering as a separate material

//notes: we model pocket dimensions after the M18 smoke grenade, since it's stated to fit inside the pouch and is much larger than the M84 stun grenade aka flashbang
description: A nylon pouch for storing a flashbang grenade.  It can also accomodate a smoke grenade.

variants.description: A nylon pouch for storing a single flashbang grenade.  It is large enough to fit a smoke grenade as well.  <variant_multicam>
A nylon pouch for storing a single flashbang grenade.  It is large enough to fit a smoke grenade as well.  <variant_multicam_black>
A nylon pouch for storing a single flashbang grenade.  It is large enough to fit a smoke grenade as well.  <variant_black>
A nylon pouch for storing a single flashbang grenade.  It is large enough to fit a smoke grenade as well.  <variant_coyote>
A nylon pouch for storing a single flashbang grenade.  It is large enough to fit a smoke grenade as well.  <variant_ranger>

//longest_side: no longest side, since the pouch appears to be easily-foldable

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of M18 smoke grenade (539 g), rounded to the nearest 50/100 g
//max_contains_volume: volume of M18 smoke grenade, rounded to the nearest 50/100 ml
pocket_data.//max_item_length: longest side of M18 smoke grenade

description: A nylon pouch for storing up to 6 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other types of grenades, like 37mm, flashbangs, smoke, and so on.

variants.description: A large nylon pouch with a hook-and-loop flap, intended to hold up to 6 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other similar types of grenades.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_multicam>

A large nylon pouch with a hook-and-loop flap, intended to hold up to 6 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other similar types of grenades.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_black>

A large nylon pouch with a hook-and-loop flap, intended to hold up to 6 40mm grenades.  Could also be used to store other similar types of grenades.  Like many other pouches, this one flattens out when not filled.  <variant_coyote>

//pocket_data: ideally, this would be modelled with 6× separate holster slots
this would enable storing any item with appropriate dimensions in it, thus giving even more utility to the pouch
however, slots cause game to throw loadtime error because it fails to load 4× grenades into the pouch (citing weight, but that part appears to be faulty reporting)
ammo restriction has been tested not to cause the same kind of errors
